title: ICE: Explicit deref of non-derefable type: _

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
Following Code "suddenly" (TM) gives a compiler panick:

``` rust
use std::iter::Iterator;

fn map<T, U, I: Iterator<T>>(fun: |T| -> U, mut iter: I) -> Vec<U> {
    let mut acc = vec![];
    for elt in iter {
        acc.push(fun(elt));
    }
    acc
}

fn main() {
    let x = map(|&x| x + 2, vec![1u,2,3].iter());
    println!("{}", x);
}
```

```
RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc main.rs
main.rs:12:15: 12:17 error: internal compiler error: Explicit deref of non-derefable type: _
main.rs:12  let x = map(|&x| x + 2, vec![1u,2,3].iter());
                         ^~
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
```
